action.content: Turn 0

You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Write your plan for your next actions on the line below your action, starting with "Next actions:".
For example:
> open cupboard
Next actions: take orange, eat orange

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the sandwich on the side table, the book on the shelf and the mop in the cupboard.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter and a cupboard. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a hallway, a living room and a pantry here.

> open cupboard
Next actions: check if there's a mop in the cupboard, take mop if it's there, close cupboard. If mop isn't in the cupboard, search the pantry and living room for the mop.
Turn 1
The cupboard is now open. In the cupboard there is a plate.

> take plate
Next actions: Close the cupboard, then go to the pantry to look for the mop since it wasn't in the cupboard. If the mop is not in the pantry, proceed to the living room to continue the search. Remember to put down the plate before picking up the mop, as only two items can be carried at once.
Turn 2
You take the plate. In your inventory you have a plate.

> go to pantry
Next actions: Look for the mop in the pantry. If found, take it. If not, return to the kitchen and head to the living room to continue the search for the mop. Remember to put down the plate before picking up the mop, as only two items can be carried at once.
Turn 3
You are in a pantry now. There are a freezer and a refrigerator. The freezer is closed. The refrigerator is closed. There is a passage to a kitchen here.

> open refrigerator
Next actions: Check if the mop is inside the refrigerator. If not, open the freezer and check there. If the mop is still not found, return to the kitchen and head to the living room to continue the search. Remember to put down the plate before picking up the mop, as only two items can be carried at once.
Turn 4
The refrigerator is now open. In the refrigerator there are a sandwich, a peach, a orange, a banana and a apple.

> take sandwich
Next actions: Close the refrigerator, then go back to the kitchen and place the sandwich on the side table. After placing the sandwich, return to the pantry and put down the plate. Then, search for the mop in the living room. Remember to pick up the mop when found and make sure not to exceed the two-item limit in the inventory.
Turn 5
You take the sandwich. In your inventory you have a plate and a sandwich.

> go to kitchen
Next actions: Place the sandwich on the side table, then return to the pantry to put down the plate. After that, search the living room for the mop. Remember to pick up the mop when found and make sure not to exceed the two-item limit in the inventory. Once the mop is found, return to the kitchen and put it in the cupboard. After that, search for the book to put on the shelf.
Turn 6
You are in a kitchen now. There are a counter and a cupboard. The cupboard is open. There are passages to a hallway, a living room and a pantry here.

> put sandwich on side table
Next actions: Go back to the pantry and put down the plate. Then, search the living room for the mop. Remember to pick up the mop when found and make sure not to exceed the two-item limit in the inventory. Once the mop is found, return to the kitchen and put it in the cupboard. After that, search for the book to put on the shelf. Keep track of the inventory limit and manage items accordingly.
Turn 7
You can't see a side table here.

> go to living room
Next actions: Upon arriving in the living room, search for the side table to place the sandwich on it. Also, look for the book to put on the shelf. If the mop is found in the living room, pick it up and remember to manage the inventory limit. If the side table or book is not found, return to the kitchen and search other areas as needed. Always keep track of the inventory limit and manage items accordingly.
Turn 8
You are in a living room now. There are a chair, a couch, a shelf and a table. There are passages to a hallway and a kitchen here.

> put sandwich on table
Next actions: Check if the table is the side table mentioned in the goal. If it is, great! If not, find the side table and place the sandwich there. Then, look for the book to put on the shelf. After placing the book, return to the kitchen to search for the mop. Remember to manage the inventory limit and pick up the mop when found. If the mop is not in the kitchen, search the pantry and other areas as needed.
Turn 9
You put the sandwich on the table.

> take plate
Next actions: Now that the sandwich is on the table (assuming it's the side table), go back to the kitchen and take the plate from the pantry. Then, search for the mop in the kitchen. If the mop is not found, check the pantry and other areas. Once the mop is located, pick it up and remember to manage the inventory limit. After obtaining the mop, return to the kitchen and put it in the cupboard. Next, search for the book to

Once the mop is located, pick it up and remember to manage the inventory limit. After obtaining the mop, return to the kitchen and put it in the cupboard. Next, search for the book to put on the shelf in the living room. Keep track of the inventory limit and manage items accordingly
